content.description: You’re No Daisy begins with the same crack start as Alive Cowboy but instead of trending right it follows the crack that goes straight up. A brute climb for sure. Because of the angle of the vertical crack falling could result in a possible hyperextended elbow so make sure you have a spotter that cares about you.
content.location:
(34.7492977, -98.7708208)

 Park at the west cattleguard in HWY 49 after passing Sunset parking and continuing west beyond Choss Boss.

 Park and walk back east to the bridge and turn right south. Walk 2-4 min south and you will find Disco Biscuit.

content.description: Yellow Cowboy Ninja sits to the left of the main Disco Biscuit lines by 15'. It is the striking splitter crack to the left of a slab. Stand Start on stacks or armbars and stuff your stuff in the crack. Enjoy a bomber splitter thighbar for a gratuitous chalkup and jam out for the topout. Great body warmup for the other lines nearby.
content.location:
(34.7492977, -98.7708208)

 Park at the west cattleguard in HWY 49 after passing Sunset parking and continuing west beyond Choss Boss.

   Park and walk back east to the bridge and turn right south. Walk 2-4 min south and you will find Disco Biscuit.

content.description: Strong Cowboy starts in the upside down T under the roof of Disco Biscuit, right in the middle of the boulder. Figure out what hands you like (well fingers) and position yourself under the crack the runs up the roof.Lift off and become a Long Cowboy or a Strong Cowboy to make this one come together. Enjoy a classic boulderer's boulder mantle or jam out like a trad climber. Exit up the slab to topout. Best Walkoff is to the right.
content.location:
(34.7492977, -98.7708208)

 Park at the west cattleguard in HWY 49 after passing Sunset parking and continuing west beyond Choss Boss.

   Park and walk back east to the bridge and turn right south. Walk 2-4 min south and you will find Disco Biscuit.

content.description: Mind flower starts at the very end of the horizontal crack right of Strong Cowboy. Start on double jams then reach (like really reeaaaaaach) for the lip of the boulder close to where strong cowboy tops out. After gaining that hand hold walk your hands right to the end of the boulder to a mean mantle finish.

Alive Cowboy starts on Disco Biscuits left underbelly in a vertical handjam crack. Match hands in this crack and lift off. Work right and turn the corner to the horizontal hand crack (or use the crimp and other holds below if you like gorilla beta). Dance across the Disco Biscuit to your right and after passing a right angled corner bust a move and mantle to begin the topout. 13-17+ hand moves with some interesting beta to boot!
content.location:
(34.7492977, -98.7708208)

content.description:
Disco Biscuit sits on the west end of the refuge just a short walk from the parking pullout east of the cattle guard. Head east along the road, pass the bridge and turn right (south) and walk 2-4 minutes until you see a large stack of rocks peeking through the brush. In the winter Disco Biscuit is clearly visible from HWY 49. 

  If you like overhung problems in the 3+/4+ range you will enjoy Mindflower, Alive Cowboy, Strong Cowboy and there is a government thighbar/stacks warmup called Yellow Cowboy Ninja.
